{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3485489,"name":"JedG","username":"JedG","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedg/{size}/244692_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T09:23:28.372Z","cooked":"

Just wanted to hear everyone’s opinions on this:

Are you considering adding a (redundant degree of freedom) coral alignment mechanism on top of having a swerve drive?

Examples of such mechanisms are 987’s end effector in 2019 as well as 2481 in 2019 (who rocked a swerve + alignment mechanism that year).

Is there any real benefit to adding something like this on top of a swerve drive or will simple left-right swerve drive strafing for lining up with the branch be more than enough to stay competitive?

Thanks!

Edit: We’ll be focusing on having a robot complete, competition ready and doing all our higher up priorities well. Then we’ll discuss if upgrading is worth it. Definitely going to prioritize other things and having driver practice first though. At this point, it seems more like an off-season upgrade for Fall events

A passive mechanism a la 2767 2019 might be the play for us though.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T17:56:11.978Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":229.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"JedG","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":5,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27152,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3485524,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T13:22:57.397Z","cooked":"

That really depends on if your controls team are capable of tuning the robot so it needs a secondary alignment system or not.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T13:22:57.397Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":289,"readers_count":288,"score":87.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/2","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485608,"name":"","username":"Ben_Martin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ben_martin/{size}/213340_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T14:53:21.607Z","cooked":"

It’s probably not the right choice for most teams, but in some cases it may make sense. Our 2019 was better because of it.

Positives

  • ability to be sloppier / less precise with driving when pulling up to score
  • deals with defense better when scoring (not relevant in this game with the protected scoring zone)

Negatives

  • Extra sensors needed
  • Extra programming time
  • Extra high weight
  • More wiring complexity for your arm/elevator
","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T14:53:21.607Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":116.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6001,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485618,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T15:01:23.721Z","cooked":"

I have been advocating hard for teams to consider this, so long as your team has the software, design time, and budget to make good use of it.

In general, if you routinely find yourself as a top 4 team an event, it may be worth the punt. (Just my opinion).

See Ben’s response above for pros/cons.

Examples
2767 in 2023 (via "twisting deformation " of the elevator to point the carriage in a different direction, pretty exotic solution for most teams)

2481 in 2019 ( via belt drive in a wide elevator carriage)

987 in 2019 (via lead screw on an arm)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T15:14:07.457Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":86.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://thebluealliance.com/team/2767/2023","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Stryke Force - Team 2767 (2023) - The Blue Alliance","clicks":47},{"url":"https://thebluealliance.com/team/987/2025","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"HIGHROLLERS - Team 987 (2025) - The Blue Alliance","clicks":22}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/4","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485641,"name":"Liu","username":"Liu346","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/liu346/{size}/125023_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T15:12:00.711Z","cooked":"

I thought about this question a lot in the offseason, since going into 2024 I didn’t really see turrets. But watching 254 along with others utilize it so well, it makes sense that it is faster because you are able to have more orientations of your robot that are able to do other game task, like intake. But the biggest thing with shooting games or pick and place is that swerve lets you maneuver most of the time but not when your being defended since they have the ability to pin your bumpers to not allow for easy rotation. I think 195 from 2019 is great example of how they would get pinned but still able to store because of their turret.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T15:12:00.711Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":57.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"Liu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27749,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9072 - Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/5","custom_user_title":"9072 - Drive Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485727,"name":"JedG","username":"JedG","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedg/{size}/244692_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:52:36.852Z","cooked":"

Yes my main worry is if the added complexity is worth it or if it’s better to have that extra few days of drive practice (which is generally the better advice but may be worth it). Would prefer to not have a heavy end effector this year too but we might be able to design it to be quite light.

I recommended to my students that we finish our v1 end effector and everything else first and then go back and re-evaluate if it would be significant enough to add it.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T17:32:52.043Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":40.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"JedG","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6001,"username":"Ben_Martin","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ben_martin/{size}/213340_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27152,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485732,"name":"","username":"Ben_Martin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ben_martin/{size}/213340_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:57:09.401Z","cooked":"

There’s a level of controls knowledge required here to do this to make it more effective than just strafing sideways.

A good way for teams to assess this would be if you were one of the teams in contention for doing a 6-note auto in 2024 or a 3-piece auto on the higher scoring locations in 2023, it may be worth a look (and even then may not be worth it). All others, I’d probably avoid it.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T18:02:01.974Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":132.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":27152,"username":"JedG","name":"JedG","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedg/{size}/244692_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6001,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485734,"name":"JedG","username":"JedG","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedg/{size}/244692_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:59:12.365Z","cooked":"

One of your posts mentioning it was actually what got me really thinking about the idea.

I’m pretty confident software, design time, and budget will be more than enough.

How many seconds do you think could a good alignment mechanism save per cycle vs a well-tuned swerve drive?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T16:59:12.365Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":36.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"JedG","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27152,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/8","custom_user_title":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485752,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T17:13:09.139Z","cooked":"
JedG:

good alignment mechanism

Likely software limited, this would be a project you would need to start now to get hardware going so software has enough time for the following gut feel savings:

Weeks 1-3: two to five seconds seems reasonable, especially on the far side of the reef. Probably a fair bit more week 1 quals assuming it is rock solid.

Weeks 4-6: two to three.

Champs: one to two.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T17:16:45.906Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/9","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485757,"name":"JedG","username":"JedG","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedg/{size}/244692_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T17:18:05.512Z","cooked":"
Ben_Martin:

There’s a level of controls knowledge required here required to do this to make it more effective than just strafing sideways.

Yes definitely agree!

We could at most do a 4 or 4.5 note auto last year as we had to drive up to the subwoofer each time. Our shooter had mechanical issues that prevented us from shooting further back which we never got the time to redesign. Our 4 note was very consistent though and we had one of the higher auto rankings in Ontario.

We did have paths and routines ready and (mostly) tested for a 5 and 6 note in the event we were able to fix the shooter though.

Being decent with software is also a new development for the team so definitely didn’t have that capability in 2023 . 2024 was definitely a learning year for us but we learned a lot in 2024 and had a lot of firsts. I expect 2025 to be a much better year programing-wise but still it may be biting off more than we can chew. Trying not to overextend ourselves this year.

I suggested we get everything else done first and do some prototyping for the alignment too and see if we want to swap out the end effector or not. Designing it so that part of the robot is easily upgradeable. Although I think it is probably not worth it for the team and we’re much better off focusing on driver practice and fine tuning everything else.

I think it would make a great off-season upgrade for Fall comps though!

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T17:46:49.713Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":142,"readers_count":141,"score":38.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"JedG","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":4,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27152,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/10","custom_user_title":"Mentor - Programming/Strategic Design","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485758,"name":"Karthik Kanagasabapathy (he/him)","username":"Karthik","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karthik/{size}/165693_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T17:18:59.590Z","cooked":"
Ben_Martin:

It’s probably not the right choice for most teams, but in some cases it may make sense.

Ben’s right on the mark here.

There’s a small number of teams, who would benefit from this sort of mechanism. These are very good teams who have the resources to execute and pull this off.

There’s a larger group of teams, who could pull off a mediocre version of this mechanism, but it would only provide minimal to zero net-functionality advantage.

There’s an even larger group of teams who can’t pull this off and would be worse off because of attempting it and diverting resources from the rest of their robot.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T17:18:59.590Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":196.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482258,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism","display_username":"Karthik Kanagasabapathy (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":967,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-redundant-dof-fine-adjustment-mechanism/482258/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3485763,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T17:23:30.945Z","cooked":"

Yeah, this is probably a top 100 teams in the world (by controls knowledge) thing to have a competitive edge. The top 20 of which will have a meaningful advantage.

Top 300 (at best) for an implementation that has is marginal gains. Below that you are better off using the drive base.

Personally, I think passive alignment mechanisms will prove to be useful (compare FTC Powerplay, where V-shaped pole guides became common). Because the Reef pipes are rigid, a passive aligner will require some compliance in the end effector, but this seems simpler than an active DOF for alignment.

Agree, I think this would be a fun offseason upgrade for teams that feel they have the capability to take it on.

Extra point – our 2023 robot was going to have a powered slide mechanism on the top bar. It was fully built at one point, but it was abandoned for high weight / complexity reasons (and the need to solve more important problems for the chosen architecture, like improving consistency for intaking/orienting cones). It’s definitely much less important than your core functions, and an investment if you do it.

Some passive alignment in here:

FRC 340 G.R.R. | 2025 Build Thread | Open Alliance FRC Open Alliance
The Goose Neck Shortly after the game was announced, we determined that many teams will likely spend a good portion of their cycle time lining their robot up with the reef. With 1.25" diameter of the reef pipes and 4" ID of the coral, robots essentially have to be positioned within a 2.75" window to score. While drive practice will certainly aid in speeding up the alignment process, we decided we should still build our scoring mechanism to allow for the robot to not be perfectly centered on a r…
